title: Alessandra Vidal Meza
text:
I’m a PhD student at UC Santa Barbara’s Bren School of Environmental Science & Management, advised by Ruth Oliver. I use tracking technologies to gather ecological insight about wildlife and support the conservation of our more-than-human relations. When I’m not coding away on my computer, you can find me outside on a trail, swimming in the ocean, or logging a wildlife sighting.
Stroll around my site to learn more about me and my work!

title: Teaching Data Science & Stewardship
text:
Teaching Data Science & Stewardship
I have contributed to teaching the following courses and workshops, as a guest instructor or teaching assistant (TA):

   Geographic Information Sciences (GIS)


EDS 223: Geospatial Analysis & Remote Sensing, UC Santa Barbara (2024-25; TA)
ENV S 154: GIS for Environmental Applications, UC Santa Barbara (2025; TA)


   Research Computing


EDS 212: Essential Math in Environmental Data Science, UC Santa Barbara (2025; TA)
EDS 221: Scientific Programming Essentials, UC Santa Barbara (2025; TA)
EDS 214: Analytical Workflows and Scientific Reproducibility, UC Santa Barbara (2025; TA)
Software Carpentry: R For Reproducible Scientific Analysis, Institute for Tribal Environmental Professionals (2024; Guest)


   Data Sovereignty and Stewardship


ENV S 194TK: Traditional Ecological Knowledge Studies, UC Santa Barbara (2024-25; Guest) {slides} 
ESM 513: Environmental Research Design, UC Santa Barbara (2024; Guest)
